meanings.definition: To give birth to a lamb or lambs.
meanings.sent1: The sheep will yean in the spring.
meanings.sent2: The ewe yeaned two healthy lambs yesterday.
meanings.sent3: The farmer chuckled as he watched the ewe yean in the barn.
meanings.sent4: The meadow seemed to yean with new life as the lambs frolicked.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the ewe yeaning echoed through the valley.

meanings.sent1: The cat will yean her kittens soon.
meanings.sent2: The mare yeaned a beautiful foal last night.
meanings.sent3: The zookeeper was amazed to see the panda yean twins.
meanings.sent4: The garden seemed to yean with flowers after the rain.
meanings.sent5: The forest echoed with the sounds of animals yeaning.
